alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:24AM EST until December 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Broome County in central New York... Southeastern Tioga County in central New York... Northwestern Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1000 AM EST. * At 524 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Binghamton, Johnson City, Endicott, Vestal, Kirkwood, Conklin, Hallstead, New Milford, Great Bend, Little Meadows, Friendsville, Brackney, Vestal Center, Endwell, Chenango Bridge, West Corners, Union Center, Tioga Terrace, Sanitaria Springs and Apalachin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
